item.title: Idk
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:13, topic:71311”][quote author=ZeroFreeze link=topic=104823.msg1176328#msg1176328 date=1176899608]

tbh the game server would be coded in c/c++

You don’t know that unless you’ve got a relative who works at jagex.
It could be coded in c/c++.
[/quote]to be honest, it would be stupid not to for a server as large scale as a runescape game server[/quote]

I had this conversation with Sean once. The response from him went something like “mhmhmh noob mhmhmh hotspot mhmhmh servermode mhmhm l2play!”

I think, roughly translated, this means “You idiot Mopman, Java would be fine for the game server, with the nessecary VM optimisations.”

I still say it’s C++ though.

Read full topic

item.title: Idk
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

There is an MMORPG called ‘Ragnarok’, and guess how one of the many private servers (the server itself) was made? Some guy hacked into the Korean Ragnarok servers and got the source Almost no one uses it though (it’s called Aegis), since it’s pretty damn illegal. Most people use a Ragnarok server called ‘eAthena’.

Read full topic

item.title: Idk
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Yeah it’s possible, only it’s pretty hard. But there are people who hacked the pentagon so rs servers can be hacked too
But only hacking doesn’t let you change anything to your account. Because the account files are stored on 1 of the 6 userfile servers.
So not the world servers -.-
Also even if you had a file, it would be protected in some kind. They would know it would be changed by someone, so they just ban you. If you deleted all the files they would restore a backup. (Which isn’t connected I think)
The only thing you might find interresting is the complete server source and client source. Would make creating bot’s lots easier ;). And making private servers would be a piece of cake

Read full topic
